verses.verse: ‘This is the law when a man dies in a tent: All who come into the tent and all who are in the tent shall be unclean seven days;
and every (Lev. 11:32; Num. 31:20) open vessel, which has no cover fastened on it, is unclean.
(Num. 19:11; 31:19) Whoever in the open field touches one who is slain by a sword or who has died, or a bone of a man, or a grave, shall be unclean seven days.
‘And for an unclean person they shall take some of the (Num. 19:9) ashes of the heifer burnt for purification from sin, and running water shall be put on them in a vessel.

A clean person shall take (Ps. 51:7) hyssop and dip it in the water, sprinkle it on the tent, on all the vessels, on the persons who were there, or on the one who touched a bone, the slain, the dead, or a grave.

The clean person shall sprinkle the unclean on the third day and on the seventh day; (Lev. 14:9) and on the seventh day he shall purify himself, wash his clothes, and bathe in water; and at evening he shall be clean.

‘But the man who is unclean and does not purify himself, that person shall be cut off from among the assembly, because he has (Num. 19:13) defiled the sanctuary of the LORD. The water of purification has not been sprinkled on him; he is unclean.
It shall be a perpetual statute for them. He who sprinkles the water of purification shall wash his clothes; and he who touches the water of purification shall be unclean until evening.
(Hag. 2:11-13) Whatever the unclean person touches shall be unclean; and (Lev. 15:5) the person who touches it shall be unclean until evening.’ ”

Moses’ Error at Kadesh Then (Num. 13:21; 33:36) the children of Israel, the whole congregation, came into the Wilderness of Zin in the first month, and the people stayed in (Num. 13:26) Kadesh; and (Ex. 15:20; Num. 26:59) Miriam died there and was buried there.
(Ex. 17:1) Now there was no water for the congregation; (Num. 16:19, 42) so they gathered together against Moses and Aaron.
And the people (Ex. 17:2; Num. 14:2) contended with Moses and spoke, saying: “If only we had died (Num. 11:1, 33; 14:37; 16:31-35, 49) when our brethren died before the LORD!
(Ex. 17:3) Why have you brought up the assembly of the LORD into this wilderness, that we and our animals should die here?
And why have you made us come up out of Egypt, to bring us to this evil place? It is not a place of grain or figs or vines or pomegranates; nor is there any water to drink.”

So Moses and Aaron went from the presence of the assembly to the door of the tabernacle of meeting, and (Num. 14:5; 16:4, 22, 45) they fell on their faces. And (Num. 14:10) the glory of the LORD appeared to them.
Then the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,

(Ex. 4:17, 20; 17:5, 6) “Take the rod; you and your brother Aaron gather the congregation together. Speak to the rock before their eyes, and it will yield its water; thus (Neh. 9:15; Ps. 78:15, 16; 105:41; Is. 43:20; 48:21; (1 Cor. 10:4)) you shall bring water for them out of the rock, and give drink to the congregation and their animals.”
So Moses took the rod (Num. 17:10) from before the LORD as He commanded him.
And Moses and Aaron gathered the assembly together before the rock; and he said to them, (Ps. 106:33) “Hear now, you rebels! Must we bring water for you out of this rock?”

Then Moses lifted his hand and struck the rock twice with his rod; (Ex. 17:6; Deut. 8:15; Ps. 78:16; Is. 48:21; (1 Cor. 10:4)) and water came out abundantly, and the congregation and their animals drank.

Then the LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron, “Because (Num. 20:28; 27:14; Deut. 1:37; 3:26, 27; 34:5) you did not believe Me, to (Lev. 10:3; Ezek. 20:41; 36:23; 1 Pet. 3:15) hallow Me in the eyes of the children of Israel, therefore you shall not bring this assembly into the land which I have given them.”
(Deut. 33:8; Ps. 106:32) This was the water of Meribah, because the children of Israel contended with the LORD, and He was hallowed among them.

Passage Through Edom Refused (Judg. 11:16, 17) Now Moses sent messengers from Kadesh to the king of (Gen. 36:31-39) Edom. (Deut. 2:4; Obad. 10-12) “Thus says your brother Israel: ‘You know all the hardship that has befallen us,
(Gen. 46:6; Acts 7:15) how our fathers went down to Egypt, (Ex. 12:40) and we dwelt in Egypt a long time, (Ex. 1:11; Deut. 26:6; Acts 7:19) and the Egyptians afflicted us and our fathers.
(Ex. 2:23; 3:7) When we cried out to the LORD, He heard our voice and (Ex. 3:2; 14:19) sent the Angel and brought us up out of Egypt; now here we are in Kadesh, a city on the edge of your border.

Please (Num. 21:22) let us pass through your country. We will not pass through fields or vineyards, nor will we drink water from wells; we will go along the King’s Highway; we will not turn aside to the right hand or to the left until we have passed through your territory.’ ”
Then (Num. 24:18; Ps. 137:7; Ezek. 25:12, 13; Obad. 10-15) Edom said to him, “You shall not pass through my land, lest I come out against you with the sword.”

So the children of Israel said to him, “We will go by the Highway, and if I or my livestock drink any of your water, (Deut. 2:6, 28) then I will pay for it; let me only pass through on foot, nothing more.”
Then he said, (Judg. 11:17) “You shall not pass through.” So Edom came out against them with many men and with a strong hand.
